message.content:
cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the classification of user phone call behavior using machine learning techniques. The proposed technique involves improving the naive Bayes classifier for noise detection, which is a common technique used in machine learning for classification tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval), as these sub-categories are closely related to the topic of the paper. Additionally, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) are also possible sub-categories, as the paper discusses the potential negative consequences of noisy instances in mobile phone data and proposes a technique to improve the accuracy of classification, which are relevant to these sub-categories.
